Service.Name: Clinic Services
Service.Description: A wide range of healthcare services including services for prevention or treatment of health conditions or illnesses, surgery, and other care provided in a centralized facility.

Service.Name: Dental Services
Service.Description: Services provided by a dentist or dental assistant to diagnose, prevent and treat conditions of the mouth, teeth, and face.

Service.Name: Diagnostic Services
Service.Description: Services used to identify a disease based on signs and symptoms. Tools to identify a disease can include blood and urine tests.

Service.Name: Emergency Hospital Services
Service.Description: Services provided in a hospital emergency department to treat illnesses or injuries that are medical emergencies.

Service.Name: Eyeglasses
Service.Description: Lenses or frames used to aid vision.

Service.Name: Home Health Services
Service.Description: A wide range of services performed at someone's home. They can include skilled and non-skilled services, part-time nursing care, different types of therapy (e.g. PT, OT, speech and audiology), help with activities of daily living and homemaker services such as cleaning and meal preparation.

Service.Name: Inpatient Hospital Services
Service.Description: Any services that a person might receive at a hospital while they are staying overnight. These could include services from a doctor or nurse, lab work, surgery, drugs, and food and bed.

Service.Name: Lab and X-ray Services:
Service.Description: Services such as blood and urine tests and x-ray images ordered by a medical professional to screen for or diagnose a medical condition.

Service.Name: Nursing Facility Services
Service.Description: Skilled nursing, rehabilitation, and other services provided in a facility to help people with illness, injuries, or other disabilities to recover or to improve, and to provide long term care to those who need support with daily activities such as bathing, dressing and eating.

Service.Name: Physicians Services
Service.Description: Healthcare services, such as office visits, provided by a licensed doctor.

Service.Name: Prescribed Drugs
Service.Description: Drugs that a person can get only if a doctor (or another authorized healthcare provider) gives permission for them through a prescription.

Service.Name: Clinic Services
Service.Description: A wide range of healthcare services including services for prevention or treatment of health conditions or illnesses, surgery, and other care provided in a centralized facility.

Service.Name: Dental Services
Service.Description: Services provided by a dentist or dental assistant to diagnose, prevent and treat conditions of the mouth, teeth, and face.

Service.Name: Diagnostic Services
Service.Description: Services used to identify a disease based on signs and symptoms. Tools to identify a disease can include blood and urine tests.

Service.Name: Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnostic Treatment Services
Service.Description: Regularly scheduled screenings to identify physical and mental conditions and vision, hearing, and dental problems for people 20 years or younger. Also includes treatment of problems identified through screening regardless of whether that treatment is otherwise part of the Medicaid program.

Service.Name: Emergency Hospital Services
Service.Description: Services provided in a hospital emergency department to treat illnesses or injuries that are medical emergencies.

Service.Name: Home Health Services
Service.Description: A wide range of services performed at someone's home. They can include skilled and non-skilled services, part-time nursing care, different types of therapy (e.g. PT, OT, speech and audiology), help with activities of daily living and homemaker services such as cleaning and meal preparation.

Service.Name: Inpatient Hospital Services
Service.Description: Any services that a person might receive at a hospital while they are staying overnight. These could include services from a doctor or nurse, lab work, surgery, drugs, and food and bed.

Service.Name: Lab and X-ray Services:
Service.Description: Services such as blood and urine tests and x-ray images ordered by a medical professional to screen for or diagnose a medical condition.

Service.Name: Nursing Facility Services
Service.Description: Skilled nursing, rehabilitation, and other services provided in a facility to help people with illness, injuries, or other disabilities to recover or to improve, and to provide long term care to those who need support with daily activities such as bathing, dressing and eating.

Service.Name: Physicians Services
Service.Description: Healthcare services, such as office visits, provided by a licensed doctor.

Service.Name: Prescribed Drugs
Service.Description: Drugs that a person can get only if a doctor (or another authorized healthcare provider) gives permission for them through a prescription.

Service.Name: Psychologist Services
Service.Description: Services from someone who has been trained to diagnose and treat a variety of problems through therapy and counseling. These can include mental health problems, distress, emotional disturbances, and others.

TerritoryData.HealthCareResourceContact: Medically Indigent Program (MIP) MIP is a locally funded program administered by the Department of Public Health and Social Services which provides assistance with health care costs to individuals who are not eligible for Medicaid or Medicare. Service.Name: Clinic Services
Service.Description: A wide range of healthcare services including services for prevention or treatment of health conditions or illnesses, surgery, and other care provided in a centralized facility.

Service.Name: Dental Services
Service.Description: Services provided by a dentist or dental assistant to diagnose, prevent and treat conditions of the mouth, teeth, and face.

Service.Name: Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnostic Treatment Services
Service.Description: Regularly scheduled screenings to identify physical and mental conditions and vision, hearing, and dental problems for people 20 years or younger. Also includes treatment of problems identified through screening regardless of whether that treatment is otherwise part of the Medicaid program.

Service.Name: Emergency Hospital Services
Service.Description: Services provided in a hospital emergency department to treat illnesses or injuries that are medical emergencies.

Service.Name: Eyeglasses
Service.Description: Lenses or frames used to aid vision.

Service.Name: Family Planning Services
Service.Description: Medical services for diagnosis, treatment, counseling, drugs, supplies, or devices prescribed or provided by a doctor or nurse to individuals of child-bearing age, to help them determine how many children they will have and how far apart in age their children will be spaced.

Service.Name: Home Health Services
Service.Description: A wide range of services performed at someone's home. They can include skilled and non-skilled services, part-time nursing care, different types of therapy (e.g. PT, OT, speech and audiology), help with activities of daily living and homemaker services such as cleaning and meal preparation.

Service.Description: Any services that a person might receive at a hospital while they are staying overnight. These could include services from a doctor or nurse, lab work, surgery, drugs, and food and bed.

Service.Name: Lab and X-ray Services:
Service.Description: Services such as blood and urine tests and x-ray images ordered by a medical professional to screen for or diagnose a medical condition.

Service.Name: Nursing Facility Services
Service.Description: Skilled nursing, rehabilitation, and other services provided in a facility to help people with illness, injuries, or other disabilities to recover or to improve, and to provide long term care to those who need support with daily activities such as bathing, dressing and eating.

Service.Description: Healthcare services, such as office visits, provided by a licensed doctor.

Service.Description: Drugs that a person can get only if a doctor (or another authorized healthcare provider) gives permission for them through a prescription.
